title: Can a black hole become too big? - Quora

response.answer_text: In theory BHs can grow to any size (unless they all merge into one super-BH that subsequently absorbs everything (highly unlikely)) — as lomg as the CMB radiation is “hotter” than a (any) BH, all BHs will keep getting bigger, all the time, as they keep absorbing CMB energy. This is true (in theory, that is) even if Hawking’s BH “evaporation” hypothesis becomes experimentally/observationally supported (unlikely). And — again, in theory — all BHs, except (hypothetical) “micro” BHs (which are yet to be discovered), have “temperatures” way below the CMB. To my understanding, that makes “Hawking radiation” violate the second law, as it says that energy can never (or rather, have never been observed to) flow from “cold” to “hot” — only the other way around. But (to paraphrase “Bones” McCoy (Star Trek): “I’m a programmer, dammit, not an astrophysicist” … AFAIK, no theoretical “upper BH mass limit” exists.

There does not appear to be an upper limit. The limiting factor is how fast material can be pulled in from around the black hole. If one is sitting in the middle of a galaxy the size of ours (which contains about 100 billion stars) - then to get the size of S5 0014+81 would require it to ‘eat’ about 40% of the galaxy. We could certainly imagine such a giant eating an entire galaxy - but it’s going to be far enough away from other galaxies that it’s gluttony would slow *WAY* down once it had done that. Of course there are MUCH larger galaxies out there - but the Milky Way isn’t exactly tiny. So I would imagine that, given the right circumstances, you could get much more massive black holes than S5 0014+81 - but because such a thing could only reasonably be situated in one of the larger galaxies - they are unlikely to be common.

Black holes become heavier when they gobble up nearby things (matter). Black holes combine to form bigger black holes of more mass which release gravitation waves. So black holes increase in size. Most probably the maximum mass is upto 5 billion solar masses
